result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijahwan Demond Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample, pay related  surcharges.   To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 6/3/2031.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after five (5) years of Initial Confinement.
            ***June 23, 2014/Judge J.D. Watts: ORDER AMENDING JOC: the joc shall be amended to state zero (0) days sentence credit on this charge.***

******8-25-14 Judge Watts, Court ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended by changing eligibility for CIP and WSAP to non-eligibility for CIP and WSAP *******
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a parenting program and an anger management program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijahwan Demond Wilson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed and Filed: Decision and Order Denying Motion for Sentence Modification
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence modification.
Amending Judgment of Conviction to reflect non-eligibility for CIP and WSAP programs, signed and filed. Copy sent to Drug Abuse Correction Center. sab
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, for review. jbs
Letter from DOC seeking review of ERP/CIP eligibility.

Amending Judgment of Conviction signed, filed and distributed.
     THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to state zero (0) days of sentence credit.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, for review. mag
DOC request to review sentence credit order.

Defendant Elijahwan Demond Wilson in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Elijahwan Demond Wilson in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 17 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 10 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 7 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 119 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 5 years of Initial Confinement.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/3/2031; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/3/2031; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
-Successfully complete an Anger Management Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the orally amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Court orders final pre-trial and jury trial vacated.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.    Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Elijahwan Demond Wilson in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Elijahwan Demond Wilson in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Reckless Injury Use of A Dangerous Weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.23(1)(a) & 969.63(1)(b), a Class D felony.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing FEBRUARY 25, 2014  received and filed. (9 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Richard Johnson - SPD.
to Suppress Eyewitness Identification, received and filed. sab

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Elijahwan Demond Wilson not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 6/4/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 6/18/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Defendant Elijahwan Demond Wilson in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Elijahwan Demond Wilson in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Tracy Becker-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEONTE R-H. AND SHERELLE F.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Elijahwan Demond Wilson in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Elijahwan Demond Wilson in custody.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
